description.narrative: Support to the fulfillment of human rights, access to justice and empowerment of youth and women

activity-description.narrative: Provide technical support of Governance and Human Rights Promotion

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative:
I1: Functional NHRI
I2: National Law Reform Unit
I3: % reduction GBV cases

comment.narrative:
BL: Office of the Ombudsman and Draft Ombudsman Act 1997
BL: Legislative drafting division of the Attorney Generals Chambers
BL: National Policy on Gender and Development
BL:

Human Rights: 1. Appoint a Consultant for Human Rights Strategy and Action Plan, including baseline and consultations. 2. Appoint National Human Rights Action Plan Steering committee members 3.Training of Government focal points on use of the Human rights recommendation database and recommendations tracking
Disability: 1. Finalise the Disability Bill for adoption by Parliament. 2. Appoint a consultant appointed to develop films capturing disability issues in the country
Rule of Law:
1. Launch of the BotswanaLII / BotsLII Project Office 2. Complete the Code of Conduct for Judiciary for inclusion in Judicial Service Regulations and publish in Government gazette. 3. Development of the DCEC Quality Management Systems 4. Development of the DCEC M&E system and capacity building of officers
Access to Justice: 1. Educational films on legal Aid Botswana 2. Website development for Legal Aid Botswana 3. Review of Botswanas Sentencing Policy 4. Conduct DCEC Anti-corruption Day publicity and events
Gender: Gender-based Violence: 1. Conduct countrywide trainings for Dikgosi on GBV 2. Conduct trainings for Department of Gender Affairs Officers on GBV in the north and south of Botswana. 3. Conduct Local Emergency Operation Centre trainings on GBV prevention and response during COVID-19 in partnership with Botswana Red Cross Society. 4. Organise Anti-GBV Awards and training of ambassadors in partnership with Men and Boys for Gender Equality. 5. Conduct GBV campaign in partnership with Botswana Bus Association and Gaborone Taxi and Local Bus Service Association. 6. Conduct GBV prevention and response educational campaign in partnership with Kgalagadi Breweries Limited.
Women in Politics: Women in politics technical working group (TWG) was set up with support from UNDP in Q4 of 2020. The TWG is comprised of members from the following organisations: Department of Gender Affairs, Independent Electoral Commission, Parliament, University of Botswana, Caucus for Women in Politics, Emang Basadi, and an independent Gender Consultant who was commissioned to undertake a 2018 study on women’s political representation in Botswana . The programme of activities has been developed and will be rolled out starting in 2021.
Youth: 1. Youth Development Fund: Youth Entrepreneurship Training Course Manual developed and published. 2. Youth Development Fund: Training on the manual to be held mid-December. 3. National Internship Programme: NIP reviewed and recommendations made for presentation to Cabinet. 4. Botswana National Youth Council: Grantmaking system reviewed and revised. 5. Botswana National Youth Council: 3 virtual dialogues held and the fourth and final for the year to be held this Friday

1. Human Rights Unit: Consultant appointed for Human Rights Strategy and Action Plan, including baseline and consultations. 2. National Human Rights Action Plan: Steering committee members appointed. 3. Human rights recommendation database: Training of Government focal points on use of recommendations tracking database complete.
Disability: Disability Bill ready for adoption by Parliament. Disability films: consultant appointed to develop films capturing disability issues in the country
Rule of Law:
1. BotswanaLII / BotsLII Project Office launched. 2. Judicial ethics: Code of Conduct for Judiciary for inclusion in Judicial Service Regulations completed and published in Government gazette. 3. DCEC Quality Management Systems consultancy at advanced stage and to be completed in 2021 4. DCEC M&E Consultant appointed to set up M&E system and build capacity of officers
Access to Justice: 1. Educational films on legal Aid Botswana captured and undergoing final edits 2. Website development for Legal Aid Botswana initiated, currently at advanced stage and will be completed in 2021 3. A consultant to review Botswanas Sentencing Policy has been appointed and started working on the assignment DCEC: Anti-corruption Day publicity and events ongoing
Gender: Gender-based Violence: 1. 4 Dikgosi GBV trainings took place in 2020: Hukuntsi, Tsabong, Francistown and Selebi Phikwe. 2. 71 Department of Gender Affairs Officers trained on GBV in north and south of Botswana. 3. 50 Local Emergency Operation Centre trained: 649 community leaders in 49 villages trained on GBV prevention and response during COVID-19 in partnership with Botswana Red Cross Society. 4. Anti-GBV Awards and training of ambassadors in partnership with Men and Boys for Gender Equality. 5. Commitment to prevent GBV campaign in partnership with Botswana Bus Association and Gaborone Taxi and Local Bus Service Association. 6. GBV prevention and response educational campaign in partnership with Kgalagadi Breweries Limited.
Women in Politics: Women in politics technical working group (TWG) was set up with support from UNDP in Q4 of 2020. The TWG is comprised of members from the following organisations: Department of Gender Affairs, Independent Electoral Commission, Parliament, University of Botswana, Caucus for Women in Politics, Emang Basadi, and an independent Gender Consultant who was commissioned to undertake a 2018 study on women’s political representation in Botswana . The programme of activities has been developed and will be rolled out starting in 2021.
Youth: 1. Youth Development Fund: Youth Entrepreneurship Training Course Manual developed and published. 2. Youth Development Fund: Training on the manual to be held mid-December. 3. National Internship Programme: NIP reviewed and recommendations made for presentation to Cabinet. 4. Botswana National Youth Council: Grantmaking system reviewed and revised. 5. Botswana National Youth Council: 3 virtual dialogues held and the fourth and final for the year to be held this Friday.

Component 1: 1. National Human Rights Strategy and Action Plan drafted and finalised including national consultations with Government and civil society 2. Recruit a consultant for review of National Youth Policy 3. Finalise National Sentencing Policy and Implementation Plan Component 2: 4. Finalise and launch legal literacy short films on common legal issues and social media campaign 5. Finalise website and social media platforms design and launch for roll-out 6. Technical support to the Directorate of Corruption and Economic Crime to develop a Quality Management System incorporating standard operating procedures to be followed in investigating corruption cases 7. Support the development of guidelines and training of the newly formed committees 8. Support to resuscitate of District Youth Committees as per the Grant-making Study recommendations 9. Evaluation of the Youth Development Fund - Consolidate the Recommendations of the Needs and Opportunities Study, Entrepreneurship Manual and the Grant Making studies to identify relevance to Youth Development Fund 10. Establish Gender-based Violence Referral System 11. Roll out of Local Emergency Operation Centre GBV Prevention and Response Training 12. Radio show for people living with disabilities 13. Public awareness on CRPD, National Disability Framework and stigma reduction (short films on 8 guiding principles of CRPD and social media campaign)
Component 3: 14. Technical support for Capacity Building of M&E Officers and M&E Focal persons at DCEC 15. Technical support for the development of M&E Framework and Manual for the DCEC for results-based performance measurement and reporting

Component 1: 1. UNDP has been supporting the development of the National Human Rights Strategy and Action Plan since late 2020. Support has included technical support for the National Human Rights Consultative Committee and Human Rights Taskforce (of which UNDP is a member), support for national consultations and the consultant who is drafting the Strategy. A zero draft Strategy was delivered on 8 November 2021 (enclosed). This is not for distribution and is considered by MOPAGPA to be a very sensitive document. It is in the package for information and will be finalised in the coming weeks through a series of consultations with the Committee and Taskforce. The concern is that Government is not championing in the Strategy (despite the Human Rights Unit in the Office of the President) being very actively engaged throughout the whole process. National consultations were sensitive (cancelled, delayed and eventually held in September 2021) and the Government has not publicised the Strategy and it was not mentioned in the President’s recent SONA (Nov. 2021). 2. Project kick off meeting held on 8/06/2021. Inception report with workplan received on 11/06/2021, National Consultations Plan received on 18/06, Consultation Tools and Stakeholder Engagement Plan received on 25/6. Technical Work Group meeting took place on 6/07/2021. TWG reviewed and approved the Inception Report and Workplan as well as National Consultations Plan and Tools. PS and DPS endorsed documents on 26/07 . District Youth / Offices Lists received from MYSC on 23/08. Funds for National Consultations administration were released on 16/09, National Consultations work commenced 17/09. The impact and effects of the high Covid 19 Cases in Botswana during the months of July to September caused extensive delays in the commencement of the national consultations, as such the national consultations only fully took off during the month of October. National Consultations are currently ongoing. This in effect has caused a delay in the overall project, as the initial completion date had been set to 31 December 2021 and has now been moved to 30 April 2022. 3. On 4/8, the activity was complete and waiting for approval from MDJS, with MDJS needing to advise regarding launch after Policy approved. 18/8 complete and consultant paid however this item should remain on list for discussion with MDJS ie approval and implementation. 26/8 Minister is pleased with Sentencing Policy and it may go to Parliament soon. 1/9 MDJS confirmed in meeting that no further action needed from UNDP.
Component 2: 4. Films and website successfully launched on 23/6 at Masa Cinema. First film episode to air on Btv on 7/7 at 8pm. All 13 films to air every Wednesday, prime time, at 8pm. Due to popular demand and impact of the films, Government has granted funding for the films to continue into 2022. 5. Films and website successfully launched on 23/6 at Masa Cinema. Website is interactive and in both Setswana and English 6. Activity completed with receipt on 20 October 2021 of Botswana Bureau of Standards (BOBS) certification of DCEC for compliance to Quality Management System ISO 9001:2015. Official certification granted on 12 October 2021 and there will continue to be BOBS surveillance audits on DCEC for the next 3 years (11 October 2024). 7. ToRs were developed jointly by BNYC and UNDP and a Consultant has been identified and contracted from the Roster at the end of September 2021. Due to extended unavailability of the BNYC management during the month of October, the project is only commenced in the 3rd week of November. The Consultant has been contracted until the 31st March 2022 and consultancy is ongoing. 8. See above. The consultant that will develop the guidelines and tools for the resuscitation and operation of the DYCs, will also assist with resuscitate the DYCs and will also conduct training for the newly resuscitated DYCs. 9. Recommendations consolidated and presented to MYSC as a power point summary for ease of implementation and action. 10. UNDP thought it best to train members of the GBV referral system to understand GBV issues before attempting to address them. Thus, the Gender Consultant virtually trained the GBV Inter-ministerial Committees (IMC) technical level staff (Permanent Secretaries) over 3 days from 23-25 August 2021 for them to each fully understand GBV before trying to mainstream gender equality issues in their respective ministries. Another completed output from the trainings is a new comprehensive national GBV plan, collaboratively drafted by the IMC and the UNDP Consultant. A training for Ministers is to take place in the first quarter of next year (2022). 11. Botswana Red Cross Society was requested to train. The training has since been completed with 813 out of the proposed 600 members of 53 Local Emergency Operation Centres trained throughout the country on GBV Prevention and Response. This method of training volunteers in communities allows for GBV knowledge to be retained in those communities and solutions be tailored and home-grown versus imposed. 12. The radio show is ongoing and currently airs each week, Wednesday from 2-3pm on Duma FM. It has been a powerful tool to both promote the newly-acceded CRPD and a platform for those living with disabilities and their caretakers to both learn and share their views on pertinent matters pertaining to PWDs. 13. Ongoing. The production company initially presented 4 out of 8 public awareness videos for review following script approval by IP and UNDP. Last batch of 4 videos was presented the week of 15 November 2021 for review. Public awareness comes at an opportune time, given accession of CPRD on 12 July 2021. The videos will be a vehicle for public education on the CRPD.
Component 3: 14. A presentation of the final stages of Result Based Monitoring and Evaluation project to DCEC Executive Management took place on the 17 November 2021, where the presentation covered: a) Results Based Monitoring and Evolution Systems; b) Roll-out and Implementation Plan; and c) the Training of Trainers (ToT) for the M&E System. Training took place on the 14-15 December 2021 and the activity is completed by mid-December 2021. The UNDP is also supporting the printing of M&E manuals for the DCEC to ensure continued implementation and reference. 15. See above—same activity.

Governance: - 2 Quality Management System ISO 9001 workshops conducted for DCEC staff. - 549 Dikgosi (Chiefs) trained on the effective implementation of GBV laws. - Development of DCEC M&E framework
Youth: - Technical Support to the Ministry of Youth and Youth Council to evaluate past programmes
Human Rights:

Governance: - 2 Quality Management System ISO 9001 workshops conducted for DCEC staff. - 549 Dikgosi (Chiefs) trained on the effective implementation of GBV laws. - Joint DCEC/UNDP TOR drafting is underway in preparation for procuring the consultancy.
Youth: - UNDP to support the evaluation of Youth Development Fund (YDF). The consultancy is at contract award stage. - UNDP will also support the consultancy to evaluate MYSC M&E system. The consultancy is at contract award stage.
Human Rights:

1. Completed review of National Youth Policy (2010) 2. District Youth Committees resuscitated as per the Grant-making Study recommendations. 3.Guidelines developed for training of the newly formed committees. 4. Dikgosi and GBV responders trained on the effective implementation of GBV laws (Penal Code and the Domestic Violence Act and Regulations) 5. Inter-ministerial Committee on Gender-based Violence as a precursor to establishment of a Gender-based Violence Referral System
